I think that metrics are fine when people just treat them as a source of i=
nformation.   The place where people mess up is when they reflexively assum=
e that particular numbers indicate problems and that there is some sort of =
moral imperative to confront all perceived problems.  The fact is, there is=
 no linkage there other than what we bring to the table.  People and teams =
have natural rhythms and we have to take care when we decide what to optimi=
ze. 

The fact that people are less productive on one particular day out of=
 the week would not surprise me.  If someone told me that a team was unifor=
mly productive every day of the week, I'd actually be rather scared of what=
 I might find if I was to visit them.

Michael
